pli-tv-kd5:7.3.6.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā veḷutaruṇe chedāpetvā veḷupattapādukāyo dhāressanti.
pli-tv-kd5:7.3.6.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics act like this?

pli-tv-kd5:7.3.9.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:7.3.9.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-kd5:7.3.10.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd5:7.3.12.eng: You shouldn’t wear shoes made of bamboo leaves.

pli-tv-kd5:7.3.13.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd5:8.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena bhaddiyaṃ tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd5:8.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Benares for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Bhaddiya.

pli-tv-kd5:8.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena bhaddiyaṃ tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd5:8.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā bhaddiye viharati jātiyā vane.
pli-tv-kd5:8.1.3.eng: he stayed in the Jātiyā Grove.

pli-tv-kd5:8.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhaddiyā bhikkhū anekavihitaṃ pādukamaṇḍanānuyogamanuyuttā viharanti, tiṇapādukaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, muñjapādukaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, pabbajapādukaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, hintālapādukaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, kamalapādukaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, kambalapādukaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi, riñcanti uddesaṃ paripucchaṃ adhisīlaṃ adhicittaṃ adhipaññaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:8.1.4.eng: At that time the monks in Bhaddiya were fond of various kinds of nice shoes. They made shoes of grass, reed, fishtail-palm leaves, and wool, and they had them made. As a consequence, they neglected recitation, questioning, the higher morality, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom.
pli-tv-kd5:8.1.4.comm: “Grass” covers two separate Pali terms, tiṇa, and kamala. “Reed” covers two separate Pali terms, muñja and pabbaja.

pli-tv-kd5:8.2.1.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd5:8.2.1.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd5:8.2.2.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhaddiyā bhikkhū anekavihitaṃ pādukamaṇḍanānuyogamanuyuttā viharissanti, tiṇapādukaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, muñjapādukaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, pabbajapādukaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, hintālapādukaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, kamalapādukaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, kambalapādukaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi, riñcissanti uddesaṃ paripucchaṃ adhisīlaṃ adhicittaṃ adhipaññan”ti.
pli-tv-kd5:8.2.2.eng: “How can the monks in Bhaddiya do this?”

pli-tv-kd5:8.2.3.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd5:8.2.4.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, bhaddiyā bhikkhū anekavihitaṃ pādukamaṇḍanānuyogamanuyuttā viharanti, tiṇapādukaṃ karontipi kārāpentipi …pe…
pli-tv-kd5:8.2.4.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the monks in Bhaddiya do this?”

pli-tv-kd5:8.2.5.pli: riñcanti uddesaṃ paripucchaṃ adhisīlaṃ adhicittaṃ adhipaññan”ti?

pli-tv-kd5:8.2.8.pli: kathañhi nāma te, bhikkhave, moghapurisā anekavihitaṃ pādukamaṇḍanānuyogamanuyuttā viharissanti, tiṇapādukaṃ karissantipi kārāpessantipi …pe…
pli-tv-kd5:8.2.8.eng: “How can those foolish men be fond of various kinds of nice shoes …

pli-tv-kd5:8.2.9.pli: riñcissanti uddesaṃ paripucchaṃ adhisīlaṃ adhicittaṃ adhipaññaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:8.2.9.eng: and neglect recitation, questioning, the higher morality, the higher mind, and the higher wisdom?

pli-tv-kd5:8.3.3.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd5:8.3.4.pli: “na, bhikkhave, tiṇapādukā dhāretabbā, na muñjapādukā dhāretabbā, na pabbajapādukā dhāretabbā, na hintālapādukā dhāretabbā, na kamalapādukā dhāretabbā, na kambalapādukā dhāretabbā, na sovaṇṇamayā pādukā dhāretabbā, na rūpiyamayā pādukā dhāretabbā, na maṇimayā pādukā dhāretabbā, na veḷuriyamayā pādukā dhāretabbā, na phalikamayā pādukā dhāretabbā, na kaṃsamayā pādukā dhāretabbā, na kācamayā pādukā dhāretabbā, na tipumayā pādukā dhāretabbā, na sīsamayā pādukā dhāretabbā, na tambalohamayā pādukā dhāretabbā.
pli-tv-kd5:8.3.4.eng: “You shouldn’t wear shoes made of grass, reed, fishtail-palm leaves, or wool; or shoes made with gold, silver, gems, beryl, crystal, bronze, glass, tin, lead, or copper.
pli-tv-kd5:8.3.4.comm: Hintāla is identified as the fishtail palm in SAF, p. 190. “Beryl” renders veḷuriya. Sp-ṭ 1.281: Veḷuriyoti vaṁsavaṇṇamaṇi, “The bamboo-colored gem is called veḷuriya.” According to PED, veḷuriya is lapis lazuli, which cannot be correct because lapis lazuli is blue. For the first four kinds of shoes I use the expression “made of”, but for the remainder, “made with”. It seems unlikely that the entire shoe would be made of these precious substances.

pli-tv-kd5:8.3.5.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd5:8.3.6.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, kāci saṅkamaniyā pādukā dhāretabbā.
pli-tv-kd5:8.3.6.comm: Going by the commentarial definition (see the next note) the contextual meaning of saṅkamaniya is essentially “mobility”, which seems redundant on translation.

pli-tv-kd5:8.3.7.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd5:8.3.8.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, tisso pādukā dhuvaṭṭhāniyā asaṅkamaniyāyo—
pli-tv-kd5:8.3.8.eng: I allow three kinds of foot stands that are fixed in place and immobile:
pli-tv-kd5:8.3.8.comm: Sp 3.251: Asaṅkamanīyāti bhūmiyaṁ suppatiṭṭhitā niccalā asaṁhāriyā, “Asaṅkamanīya: well-established on the ground, stable, not moving.”

pli-tv-kd5:8.3.9.eng: foot stands for defecating, foot stands for urinating, and foot stands for restroom ablutions.”
pli-tv-kd5:8.3.9.comm: Pāduka, translated as “shoe” above, I have here translated as “foot-stand”. This seems to be required from the current context. Sp 4.290: Passāvapādukanti ettha pādukā iṭṭhakāhipi silāhipi dārūhipi kātuṁ vaṭṭati. Vaccapādukāyapi eseva nayo, “A pāduka for urinating: here it is allowable to make a pāduka of bricks, stone, or wood. The same method also applies for pāduka for defecating.” These fixtures seem more likely to be platforms or stands than shoes in any ordinary sense.

pli-tv-kd5:9.1.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bhaddiye yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena sāvatthi tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd5:9.1.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed at Bhaddiya for as long as he liked, he set out wandering toward Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd5:9.1.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena sāvatthi tadavasari.

pli-tv-kd5:9.1.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-kd5:9.1.3.eng: he stayed in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-kd5:9.1.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū aciravatiyā nadiyā gāvīnaṃ tarantīnaṃ visāṇesupi gaṇhanti, kaṇṇesupi gaṇhanti, gīvāyapi gaṇhanti, cheppāpi gaṇhanti, piṭṭhimpi abhiruhanti, rattacittāpi aṅgajātaṃ chupanti, vacchatarimpi ogāhetvā mārenti.
pli-tv-kd5:9.1.4.eng: At this time, the monks from the group of six would grab cattle as they were crossing the Aciravatī river—by the horns, the ears, the neck, and the tail—and they would mount their backs and, motivated by lust, would touch their genitals. They even killed a calf by submerging it.

pli-tv-kd5:9.2.2.pli: “kathañhi nāma samaṇā sakyaputtiyā gāvīnaṃ tarantīnaṃ visāṇesupi gahessanti …pe…
pli-tv-kd5:9.2.2.eng: “How can the Sakyan monastics act like this?

pli-tv-kd5:9.2.3.eng: They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd5:9.2.4.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:9.2.4.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people

pli-tv-kd5:9.2.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…

pli-tv-kd5:9.3.3.eng: the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd5:9.3.4.pli: “na, bhikkhave, gāvīnaṃ visāṇesu gahetabbaṃ, na kaṇṇesu gahetabbaṃ, na gīvāya gahetabbaṃ, na cheppāya gahetabbaṃ, na piṭṭhi abhiruhitabbā.
pli-tv-kd5:9.3.4.eng: “You shouldn’t grab cattle by the horns, the ears, the neck, or the tail, and you shouldn’t mount their backs.

pli-tv-kd5:9.3.5.eng: If you do mount their backs, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd5:9.3.6.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, rattacittena aṅgajātaṃ chupitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:9.3.6.eng: And you shouldn’t touch their genitals motivated by lust.

pli-tv-kd5:9.3.7.eng: If you do, you commit a serious offense.

pli-tv-kd5:9.3.8.eng: And you shouldn’t kill a calf.

pli-tv-kd5:9.3.9.eng: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.”

pli-tv-kd5:9.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū yānena yāyanti, itthiyuttenapi purisantarena, purisayuttenapi itthantarena.
pli-tv-kd5:9.4.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six traveled in vehicles, sometimes pulled by a female animal with a man driving, at other times pulled by a male animal with a woman driving.
pli-tv-kd5:9.4.1.comm: Sp 3.253: Itthiyuttenāti dhenuyuttena. Purisantarenāti purisasārathinā. Purisayuttenāti goṇayuttena. Itthantarenāti itthisārathinā, “Itthiyuttena: with a yoked cow. Purisantarena: with a man charioteer. Purisayuttena: with a yoked bull. Itthantarenā: with a woman charioteer.”

pli-tv-kd5:9.4.3.eng: “You’d think they were at the Ganges festival!”

pli-tv-kd5:9.4.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd5:10.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu kosalesu janapade sāvatthiṃ gacchanto bhagavantaṃ dassanāya antarāmagge gilāno hoti.
pli-tv-kd5:10.1.1.eng: Soon afterwards a monk who was traveling through the Kosalan country on his way to visit the Buddha at Sāvatthī became sick.

pli-tv-kd5:10.1.2.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu maggā okkamma aññatarasmiṃ rukkhamūle nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd5:10.1.2.eng: He stepped off the path and sat down at the foot of a tree.

pli-tv-kd5:10.1.3.eng: People saw him and said to him,

pli-tv-kd5:10.1.5.pli: “Sāvatthiṃ kho ahaṃ, āvuso, gamissāmi bhagavantaṃ dassanāyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd5:10.1.5.eng: “I’m going to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha.”

pli-tv-kd5:10.2.4.pli: “Alaṃ, āvuso, paṭikkhittaṃ bhagavatā yānan”ti kukkuccāyanto yānaṃ nābhiruhi.
pli-tv-kd5:10.2.4.eng: “Thank you, but the Buddha has prohibited us from traveling in vehicles.”

pli-tv-kd5:10.2.5.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd5:10.2.5.eng: He did not accept because he was afraid of wrongdoing. Then, when he arrived at Sāvatthī, he told the monks what had happened.

pli-tv-kd5:10.2.6.eng: They in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-kd5:10.2.7.eng: “I allow a vehicle when you’re sick.”

pli-tv-kd5:10.3.2.eng: “Pulled by a female or by a male?”

pli-tv-kd5:10.3.4.eng: “I allow a rickshaw pulled by men.”
pli-tv-kd5:10.3.4.comm: Vin-vn-ṭ 3084: Hatthavaṭṭakanti hattheneva pavaṭṭetabbasakaṭaṁ, “Hatthavaṭṭakan: a cart to be moved only by hand.”

pli-tv-kd5:10.3.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno yānugghātena bāḷhataraṃ aphāsu ahosi.
pli-tv-kd5:10.3.5.eng: Soon afterwards a certain monk was even more uncomfortable when jolted around in a vehicle.

pli-tv-kd5:10.3.7.eng: “I allow a palanquin and a litter.”

pli-tv-kd5:10.4.0.eng: 8. The prohibition against high and luxurious beds

pli-tv-kd5:10.4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū uccāsayanamahāsayanāni dhārenti, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-kd5:10.4.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six used high and luxurious beds, such as:

pli-tv-kd5:10.4.2.pli: āsandiṃ, pallaṅkaṃ, gonakaṃ, cittakaṃ, paṭikaṃ, paṭalikaṃ, tūlikaṃ, vikatikaṃ, uddhalomiṃ, ekantalomiṃ, kaṭṭissaṃ, koseyyaṃ, kuttakaṃ, hatthattharaṃ, assattharaṃ, rathattharaṃ, ajinapaveṇiṃ, kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇaṃ, sauttaracchadaṃ, ubhatolohitakūpadhānanti.
pli-tv-kd5:10.4.2.eng: high couches, luxurious couches, long-fleeced woolen rugs, multi-colored woolen rugs, white woolen rugs, red woolen rugs, cotton-down quilts, woolen rugs decorated with the images of predatory animals, woolen rugs with long fleece on one side, woolen rugs with long fleece on both sides, sheets of silk embroidered with gems, silken sheets, woolen rugs like a dancer’s rug, elephant-back rugs, horse-back rugs, carriage-seat rugs, rugs made of black antelope hide, exquisite sheets made of kadalī-deer hide, seats with canopies, seats with red cushions at each end.

pli-tv-kd5:10.4.3.pli: Manussā vihāracārikaṃ āhiṇḍantā passitvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd5:10.4.3.eng: When people walking about the dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd5:10.4.4.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd5:10.5.1.eng: “You shouldn’t use high and luxurious beds, such as:

pli-tv-kd5:10.5.2.pli: āsandi, pallaṅko, gonako, cittako, paṭikā, paṭalikā, tūlikā, vikatikā, uddhalomi, ekantalomi, kaṭṭissaṃ, koseyyaṃ, kuttakaṃ, hatthattharaṃ, assattharaṃ, rathattharaṃ, ajinapaveṇi, kadalimigapavarapaccattharaṇaṃ, sauttaracchadaṃ, ubhatolohitakūpadhānaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:10.5.2.eng: high couches, luxurious couches, long-fleeced woolen rugs, multi-colored woolen rugs, white woolen rugs, red woolen rugs, cotton-down quilts, woolen rugs decorated with the images of predatory animals, woolen rugs with long fleece on one side, woolen rugs with long fleece on both sides, sheets of silk embroidered with gems, silken sheets, woolen rugs like a dancer’s rug, elephant-back rugs, horse-back rugs, carriage-seat rugs, rugs made of black antelope hide, exquisite sheets made of kadalī-deer hide, seats with canopies, seats with red cushions at each end.
pli-tv-kd5:10.5.2.comm: For a further discussion of these, see Appendix of Furniture.

pli-tv-kd5:10.5.3.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd5:10.6.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū—
pli-tv-kd5:10.6.1.eng: Soon afterwards when the monks from the group of six heard that

pli-tv-kd5:10.6.2.eng: the Buddha had prohibited high and luxurious beds,

pli-tv-kd5:10.6.3.eng: they used luxurious skins: lionskins, tiger skins, and leopard skins.

pli-tv-kd5:10.6.4.pli: Tāni mañcappamāṇenapi chinnāni honti, pīṭhappamāṇenapi chinnāni honti, antopi mañce paññattāni honti, bahipi mañce paññattāni honti, antopi pīṭhe paññattāni honti, bahipi pīṭhe paññattāni honti.
pli-tv-kd5:10.6.4.eng: They cut them to fit their beds and benches, and used them both there and elsewhere.

pli-tv-kd5:10.6.5.pli: Manussā vihāracārikaṃ āhiṇḍantā passitvā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd5:10.6.5.eng: When people walking about the dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-kd5:10.6.6.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd5:10.6.8.pli: “Na, bhikkhave, mahācammāni dhāretabbāni, sīhacammaṃ byagghacammaṃ dīpicammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:10.6.8.eng: “You shouldn’t use luxurious skins: lionskins, tiger skins, or leopard skins.

pli-tv-kd5:10.6.9.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd5:10.7.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū—
pli-tv-kd5:10.7.1.eng: Soon afterwards when the monks from the group of six heard that

pli-tv-kd5:10.7.2.eng: the Buddha had prohibited luxurious skins,

pli-tv-kd5:10.7.4.pli: Tāni mañcappamāṇenapi chinnāni honti, pīṭhappamāṇenapi chinnāni honti, antopi mañce paññattāni honti, bahipi mañce paññattāni honti, antopi pīṭhe paññattāni honti, bahipi pīṭhe paññattāni honti.
pli-tv-kd5:10.7.4.eng: They cut them to fit their beds and benches, and used them both there and elsewhere.

pli-tv-kd5:10.7.5.pli: Aññataropi pāpabhikkhu aññatarassa pāpupāsakassa kulūpako hoti.
pli-tv-kd5:10.7.5.eng: At this time a certain bad monk was associating with the family of a bad lay follower.

pli-tv-kd5:10.7.6.pli: Atha kho so pāpabhikkhu pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena tassa pāpupāsakassa nivesanaṃ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd5:10.7.6.eng: One morning that monk robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to that lay follower’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat.

pli-tv-kd5:10.7.7.pli: Atha kho so pāpupāsako yena so pāpabhikkhu tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā taṃ pāpabhikkhuṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd5:10.7.7.eng: The lay follower approached the monk, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd5:10.8.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena tassa pāpupāsakassa vacchako hoti taruṇako abhirūpo dassanīyo pāsādiko citro, seyyathāpi dīpicchāpo.
pli-tv-kd5:10.8.1.eng: At that time that lay follower had a beautiful young calf with variegated hide, just like a young leopard.

pli-tv-kd5:10.8.2.pli: Atha kho so pāpabhikkhu taṃ vacchakaṃ sakkaccaṃ upanijjhāyati.
pli-tv-kd5:10.8.2.eng: When the bad monk stared at that calf,

pli-tv-kd5:10.8.3.pli: Atha kho so pāpupāsako taṃ pāpabhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd5:10.8.3.eng: the lay follower asked him why.

pli-tv-kd5:10.8.4.pli: “kissa, bhante, ayyo imaṃ vacchakaṃ sakkaccaṃ upanijjhāyatī”ti?

pli-tv-kd5:10.8.5.eng: He replied, “I need the skin of that calf.”

pli-tv-kd5:10.8.6.pli: Atha kho so pāpupāsako taṃ vacchakaṃ vadhitvā cammaṃ vidhunitvā tassa pāpabhikkhuno pādāsi.
pli-tv-kd5:10.8.6.eng: The bad lay follower then slaughtered the calf, skinned it, and gave the skin to the bad monk.

pli-tv-kd5:10.8.7.pli: Atha kho so pāpabhikkhu taṃ cammaṃ saṅghāṭiyā paṭicchādetvā agamāsi.
pli-tv-kd5:10.8.7.eng: The monk hid the skin under his outer robe and left.

pli-tv-kd5:10.9.1.pli: Atha kho sā gāvī vacchagiddhinī taṃ pāpabhikkhuṃ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhi.
pli-tv-kd5:10.9.1.eng: The mother-cow, longing for her calf, followed behind him.

pli-tv-kd5:10.9.3.pli: “kissa tyāyaṃ, āvuso, gāvī piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhī”ti?

pli-tv-kd5:10.9.4.pli: “Ahampi kho, āvuso, na jānāmi kena myāyaṃ gāvī piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhī”ti.
pli-tv-kd5:10.9.4.eng: he said he did not know.

pli-tv-kd5:10.9.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena tassa pāpabhikkhuno saṅghāṭi lohitena makkhitā hoti.
pli-tv-kd5:10.9.5.eng: But his outer robe was smeared with blood,

pli-tv-kd5:10.9.7.pli: “ayaṃ pana te, āvuso, saṅghāṭi kiṃ katā”ti?

pli-tv-kd5:10.9.8.pli: Atha kho so pāpabhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-kd5:10.9.8.eng: When he told them what had happened,

pli-tv-kd5:10.9.9.eng: they asked, “So did you encourage someone to kill?”

pli-tv-kd5:10.9.11.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-kd5:10.9.11.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-kd5:10.9.12.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhu pāṇātipāte samādapessati, nanu bhagavatā anekapariyāyena pāṇātipāto garahito, pāṇātipātā veramaṇī pasatthā”ti.
pli-tv-kd5:10.9.12.eng: “How can a monk encourage someone to kill? Hasn’t the Buddha in many ways criticized killing and praised abstention from killing?”

pli-tv-kd5:10.9.13.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-kd5:10.10.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā taṃ pāpabhikkhuṃ paṭipucchi—
pli-tv-kd5:10.10.1.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned that bad monk:

pli-tv-kd5:10.10.2.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you encouraged someone to kill?”

pli-tv-kd5:10.10.4.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, pāṇātipāte samādapessasi, nanu mayā, moghapurisa, anekapariyāyena pāṇātipāto garahito, pāṇātipātā veramaṇī pasatthā.
pli-tv-kd5:10.10.4.eng: “Foolish man, how can you encourage someone to kill? Haven’t I in many ways criticized killing and praised abstention from killing?

pli-tv-kd5:10.10.6.pli: vigarahitvā dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd5:10.10.6.eng: After rebuking him, the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd5:10.10.8.eng: If you do, you should be dealt with according to the rule.

pli-tv-kd5:10.10.9.eng: And you shouldn’t use cattle hide.

pli-tv-kd5:10.10.10.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-kd5:10.10.11.pli: Na ca, bhikkhave, kiñci cammaṃ dhāretabbaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:10.10.11.eng: And you shouldn’t use any kind of skin.

pli-tv-kd5:10.10.12.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd5:11.1.0.eng: 10. The allowance regarding the belongings of a householder, etc.

pli-tv-kd5:11.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena manussānaṃ mañcampi pīṭhampi cammonaddhāni honti, cammavinaddhāni.
pli-tv-kd5:11.1.1.eng: At that time people’s beds and benches were upholstered and covered with skin.

pli-tv-kd5:11.1.2.eng: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not sit on them.

pli-tv-kd5:11.1.4.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gihivikataṃ abhinisīdituṃ, na tveva abhinipajjitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd5:11.1.4.eng: “I allow you to sit down on what belongs to a householder, but not to lie down on it.”

pli-tv-kd5:11.1.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vihārā cammavaddhehi ogumphiyanti.
pli-tv-kd5:11.1.5.eng: The dwellings were held together by straps of leather.
pli-tv-kd5:11.1.5.comm: This refers to monastic dwellings, not regular houses.

pli-tv-kd5:11.1.6.eng: Being afraid of wrongdoing, the monks did not sit down.

pli-tv-kd5:11.1.8.eng: “I allow you to sit down against a mere binding made of skin.”

pli-tv-kd5:12.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū saupāhanā gāmaṃ pavisanti.
pli-tv-kd5:12.1.1.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six entered the village wearing sandals.

pli-tv-kd5:12.1.3.eng: “They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-kd5:12.1.5.eng: “You shouldn’t enter the village wearing sandals.

pli-tv-kd5:12.1.6.eng: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”

pli-tv-kd5:12.1.7.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu gilāno hoti, na sakkoti vinā upāhanena gāmaṃ pavisituṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:12.1.7.eng: Soon afterwards a certain sick monk was unable to go to the village without sandals.

pli-tv-kd5:12.1.9.pli: “Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, gilānena bhikkhunā saupāhanena gāmaṃ pavisitun”ti.
pli-tv-kd5:12.1.9.eng: “I allow sick monks to enter the village wearing sandals.”

pli-tv-kd5:13.1.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahākaccāno avantīsu viharati kuraraghare papatake pabbate.
pli-tv-kd5:13.1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Mahākaccāna was staying in Avantī on Papataka Hill at Kuraraghara.

pli-tv-kd5:13.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena soṇo upāsako kuṭikaṇṇo āyasmato mahākaccānassa upaṭṭhāko hoti.
pli-tv-kd5:13.1.2.eng: At that time the lay follower Soṇa Kuṭikaṇṇa was his supporter.

pli-tv-kd5:13.1.3.pli: Atha kho soṇo upāsako kuṭikaṇṇo yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahākaccānaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd5:13.1.3.eng: On one occasion Soṇa went to Mahākaccāna, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd5:13.1.4.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho soṇo upāsako kuṭikaṇṇo āyasmantaṃ mahākaccānaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd5:13.1.5.pli: “yathā yathāhaṃ, bhante, ayyena mahākaccānena dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, nayidaṃ sukaraṃ agāraṃ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṃ ekantaparisuddhaṃ saṅkhalikhitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:13.1.5.eng: “Venerable, the way I understand your teaching, it’s not easy for one who lives at home to lead the spiritual life perfectly complete and pure as a polished conch shell.

pli-tv-kd5:13.1.6.pli: Icchāmahaṃ, bhante, kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajituṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:13.1.6.eng: I wish to cut off my hair and beard, put on the ocher robes, and go forth into homelessness.

pli-tv-kd5:13.1.7.eng: Please give me the going forth.”

pli-tv-kd5:13.2.1.pli: (…) “Dukkaraṃ kho, soṇa, yāvajīvaṃ ekaseyyaṃ ekabhattaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:13.2.1.eng: “It’s difficult, Soṇa, to live the spiritual life all one’s life, eating one meal a day and sleeping by oneself.

pli-tv-kd5:13.2.2.pli: Iṅgha tvaṃ, soṇa, tattheva agārikabhūto buddhānaṃ sāsanaṃ anuyuñja, kālayuttaṃ ekaseyyaṃ ekabhattaṃ brahmacariyan”ti.
pli-tv-kd5:13.2.2.eng: So follow the Buddhas’ instruction while remaining as a householder. At suitable times you can eat one meal a day, sleep by yourself, and abstain from sexuality.”

pli-tv-kd5:13.2.3.pli: Atha kho soṇassa upāsakassa kuṭikaṇṇassa yo ahosi pabbajjābhisaṅkhāro so paṭippassambhi.
pli-tv-kd5:13.2.3.eng: As a result, Soṇa’s intention to go forth died down.

pli-tv-kd5:13.2.4.eng: A second time Soṇa asked Mahākaccāna for the going forth, but got the same response.

pli-tv-kd5:13.2.5.pli: tatiyampi kho soṇo upāsako kuṭikaṇṇo yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahākaccānaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd5:13.2.5.eng: A third time he asked for the going forth

pli-tv-kd5:13.2.6.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho soṇo upāsako kuṭikaṇṇo āyasmantaṃ mahākaccānaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-kd5:13.2.7.pli: “yathā yathāhaṃ, bhante, ayyena mahākaccānena dhammaṃ desitaṃ ājānāmi, nayidaṃ sukaraṃ agāraṃ ajjhāvasatā ekantaparipuṇṇaṃ ekantaparisuddhaṃ saṅkhalikhitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.

pli-tv-kd5:13.2.8.pli: Icchāmahaṃ, bhante, kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajituṃ.

pli-tv-kd5:13.2.10.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākaccāno soṇaṃ upāsakaṃ kuṭikaṇṇaṃ pabbājesi.

pli-tv-kd5:13.2.11.pli: Tena kho pana samayena avantidakkhiṇāpatho appabhikkhuko hoti.
pli-tv-kd5:13.2.11.eng: At that time in the southern region of Avantī, there were few monks.

pli-tv-kd5:13.2.12.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākaccāno tiṇṇaṃ vassānaṃ accayena kicchena kasirena tato tato dasavaggaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā āyasmantaṃ soṇaṃ upasampādesi.
pli-tv-kd5:13.2.12.eng: Only after three years, with much trouble and difficulty, was Mahākaccāna able to gather a sangha of ten monks from here and there to give the full ordination to Venerable Soṇa.

pli-tv-kd5:13.3.0.eng: 12. The making known of the five favors for Mahākaccāna

pli-tv-kd5:13.3.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmato soṇassa vassaṃvuṭṭhassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—
pli-tv-kd5:13.3.1.eng: After completing the rainy-season residence, Soṇa was reflecting in private:

pli-tv-kd5:13.3.2.pli: “sutoyeva kho me so bhagavā ediso ca ediso cāti, na ca mayā sammukhā diṭṭho, gaccheyyāhaṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ, sace maṃ upajjhāyo anujāneyyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd5:13.3.2.eng: “I’ve heard that the Buddha is like this and like that, but I haven’t seen this for myself. If my preceptor allows me, I shall go and visit the Buddha, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One.”

pli-tv-kd5:13.3.3.pli: Atha kho āyasmā soṇo sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahākaccānaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd5:13.3.3.eng: Coming out from seclusion, Soṇa went to Mahākaccāna, bowed, sat down,

pli-tv-kd5:13.4.1.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā soṇo āyasmantaṃ mahākaccānaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd5:13.4.1.eng: and told him what he had thought.

pli-tv-kd5:13.4.2.pli: “idha mayhaṃ, bhante, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṃ cetaso parivitakko udapādi—

pli-tv-kd5:13.4.3.pli: ‘sutoyeva kho me so bhagavā ediso ca ediso cāti, na ca mayā sammukhā diṭṭho, gaccheyyāhaṃ taṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ, sace maṃ upajjhāyo anujāneyyā’ti;

pli-tv-kd5:13.4.4.pli: gaccheyyāhaṃ, bhante, taṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ, sace maṃ upajjhāyo anujānātī”ti.

pli-tv-kd5:13.4.6.pli: Gaccha tvaṃ, soṇa, taṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya arahantaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:13.4.6.eng: Please go and visit the Buddha, the Perfected and fully Awakened One.

pli-tv-kd5:13.5.1.pli: Dakkhissasi tvaṃ, soṇa, taṃ bhagavantaṃ pāsādikaṃ pasādanīyaṃ santindriyaṃ santamānasaṃ uttamadamathasamathaṃ anuppattaṃ dantaṃ guttaṃ yatindriyaṃ nāgaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:13.5.1.eng: You will see someone who is pleasing to the eye and inspiring confidence; who is peaceful in mind and faculties; who is attained to the supreme subduing and calm; who is tamed, guarded, and restrained in his senses—a great being.

pli-tv-kd5:13.5.2.pli: Tena hi tvaṃ, soṇa, mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vanda—
pli-tv-kd5:13.5.2.eng: Then, Soṇa, in my name, pay respect with your head at the Buddha’s feet and say,

pli-tv-kd5:13.5.3.pli: ‘upajjhāyo me, bhante, āyasmā mahākaccāno bhagavato pāde sirasā vandatī’ti.
pli-tv-kd5:13.5.3.eng: ‘Sir, my preceptor, Venerable Mahākaccāna, pays respect with his head at the Buddha’s feet.’

pli-tv-kd5:13.5.5.pli: ‘avantidakkhiṇāpatho, bhante, appabhikkhuko, tiṇṇaṃ me vassānaṃ accayena kicchena kasirena tato tato dasavaggaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā upasampadaṃ alatthaṃ;
pli-tv-kd5:13.5.5.eng: ‘In the southern region of Avantī, sir, there are few monks. Only after three years, with much trouble and difficulty, was it possible to gather a sangha of ten monks from here and there to give me the full ordination.

pli-tv-kd5:13.5.6.pli: appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe appatarena gaṇena upasampadaṃ anujāneyya.
pli-tv-kd5:13.5.6.eng: Would the Buddha allow a smaller group of monks to give the full ordination in Avantī?

pli-tv-kd5:13.6.1.pli: Avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā;
pli-tv-kd5:13.6.1.eng: In Avantī the ground is dark and hard, made rough by the hooves of cattle.

pli-tv-kd5:13.6.2.pli: appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇūpāhanaṃ anujāneyya.
pli-tv-kd5:13.6.2.eng: Would the Buddha allow sandals with multi-layered soles in Avantī?

pli-tv-kd5:13.6.3.eng: In Avantī people value bathing and cleanliness.

pli-tv-kd5:13.6.4.pli: appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe dhuvanahānaṃ anujāneyya.
pli-tv-kd5:13.6.4.eng: Would the Buddha allow unrestricted bathing in Avantī?

pli-tv-kd5:13.6.5.pli: Avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, cammāni attharaṇāni, eḷakacammaṃ ajacammaṃ migacammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:13.6.5.eng: In Avantī sheepskins, goatskins, and deerskins are used as rugs,

pli-tv-kd5:13.6.6.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, majjhimesu janapadesu eragū moragū majjārū jantū;
pli-tv-kd5:13.6.6.eng: just as eragu grass, chaff-flower grass, majjāru grass, and jantu grass are used in the central Ganges plain.
pli-tv-kd5:13.6.6.comm: For the term moragū, see Appendix of Plants.

pli-tv-kd5:13.6.7.pli: evameva kho, bhante, avantidakkhiṇāpathe cammāni attharaṇāni, eḷakacammaṃ ajacammaṃ migacammaṃ;

pli-tv-kd5:13.6.8.pli: appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe cammāni attharaṇāni anujāneyya, eḷakacammaṃ ajacammaṃ migacammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:13.6.8.eng: Would the Buddha allow sheepskins, goatskins, and deerskins as rugs in Avantī?

pli-tv-kd5:13.7.1.pli: Etarahi, bhante, manussā nissīmagatānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ cīvaraṃ denti—
pli-tv-kd5:13.7.1.eng: At present people give robe-cloth to monks who are outside the monastery zone, saying,
pli-tv-kd5:13.7.1.comm: “Robe-cloth” renders cīvara. See Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-kd5:13.7.2.comm: To clarify, the issue at stake is people giving cloth at a monastery for a monk who is away. The monk does not know he has been given cloth until he returns to the monastery.

pli-tv-kd5:13.7.3.eng: When those monks return to the monastery, they are told,

pli-tv-kd5:13.7.4.pli: “itthannāmehi te, āvuso, manussehi cīvaraṃ dinnan”ti te kukkuccāyantā na sādiyanti—
pli-tv-kd5:13.7.4.eng: “Such-and-such people have given you robe-cloth.” But being afraid of wrongdoing, they don’t accept, thinking,

pli-tv-kd5:13.7.5.eng: “We might commit an offense entailing relinquishment.”
pli-tv-kd5:13.7.5.comm: This refers to Bu Np 1:2.17.1/Bi Np 13, which prohibits a monk from keeping extra robe cloth for more than ten days. The point made here is that these monks would count the days from the moment the cloth was given. If they arrived at the monastery more than ten days after the cloth had been given, they would not be able to receive it without falling into an offense.

pli-tv-kd5:13.7.6.pli: appeva nāma bhagavā cīvare pariyāyaṃ ācikkheyyā’”ti.
pli-tv-kd5:13.7.6.eng: Would the Buddha point out a way to deal with robe-cloth?’”

pli-tv-kd5:13.7.8.pli: kho āyasmā soṇo āyasmato mahākaccānassa paṭissutvā uṭṭhāyāsanā āyasmantaṃ mahākaccānaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā senāsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sāvatthi tena pakkāmi.
pli-tv-kd5:13.7.8.eng: He got up from his seat, bowed down, and circumambulated Mahākāccāna with his right side toward him. He then put his dwelling in order, took his bowl and robe, and set out for Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-kd5:13.8.1.pli: Anupubbena yena sāvatthi jetavanaṃ anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāmo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-kd5:13.8.1.eng: When he eventually arrived, he went to the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery where he approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-kd5:13.8.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd5:13.8.2.eng: The Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda,

pli-tv-kd5:13.8.3.eng: “Ānanda, please prepare a resting place for this newly-arrived monk.”

pli-tv-kd5:13.8.5.pli: “yassa kho maṃ bhagavā āṇāpeti, ‘imassa, ānanda, āgantukassa bhikkhuno senāsanaṃ paññāpehī’ti, icchati bhagavā tena bhikkhunā saddhiṃ ekavihāre vatthuṃ, icchati bhagavā āyasmatā soṇena saddhiṃ ekavihāre vatthun”ti—
pli-tv-kd5:13.8.5.eng: “When the Buddha says this, it means he wishes to stay in the same dwelling as Venerable Soṇa.”

pli-tv-kd5:13.8.6.pli: yasmiṃ vihāre bhagavā viharati tasmiṃ vihāre āyasmato soṇassa senāsanaṃ paññāpesi.
pli-tv-kd5:13.8.6.eng: And he prepared a resting place for Soṇa in the Buddha’s dwelling.

pli-tv-kd5:13.9.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bahudeva rattiṃ ajjhokāse vītināmetvā vihāraṃ pāvisi.
pli-tv-kd5:13.9.1.eng: Then, after spending much of the night outside, the Buddha entered the dwelling,

pli-tv-kd5:13.9.2.pli: Āyasmāpi kho soṇo bahudeva rattiṃ ajjhokāse vītināmetvā vihāraṃ pāvisi.

pli-tv-kd5:13.9.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṃ paccuṭṭhāya āyasmantaṃ soṇaṃ ajjhesi—
pli-tv-kd5:13.9.3.eng: Rising early in the morning, the Buddha said to Soṇa,

pli-tv-kd5:13.9.5.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā soṇo bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā sabbāneva aṭṭhakavaggikāni sarena abhāsi.
pli-tv-kd5:13.9.5.eng: Saying, “Yes, sir,” he chanted the entire Chapter of Eights.
pli-tv-kd5:13.9.5.comm: The fourth chapter of the Sutta Nipāta.

pli-tv-kd5:13.9.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmato soṇassa sarabhaññapariyosāne abbhānumodi—
pli-tv-kd5:13.9.6.eng: When he was finished, the Buddha said,

pli-tv-kd5:13.9.8.pli: Suggahitāni kho te, bhikkhu, aṭṭhakavaggikāni, sumanasikatāni sūpadhāritāni.
pli-tv-kd5:13.9.8.eng: You have learned the Chapter of Eights well. You have remembered it well.

pli-tv-kd5:13.9.9.pli: Kalyāṇiyāpi vācāya samannāgato, vissaṭṭhāya, anelagalāya, atthassa viññāpaniyā.
pli-tv-kd5:13.9.9.eng: And you have a good voice—it’s clear, articulate, and gets the meaning across.

pli-tv-kd5:13.9.10.eng: How long have you been a monk?”

pli-tv-kd5:13.10.1.pli: “Kissa pana tvaṃ, bhikkhu, evaṃ ciraṃ akāsī”ti?
pli-tv-kd5:13.10.1.eng: “But why did it take you so long to go forth?”

pli-tv-kd5:13.10.2.pli: “Ciraṃ diṭṭho me, bhante, kāmesu ādīnavo, api ca sambādhā gharāvāsā bahukiccā bahukaraṇīyā”ti.
pli-tv-kd5:13.10.2.eng: “Well, I have long seen the downside of worldly pleasures. Still, because household life is crowded and busy, I was not able to leave.”
pli-tv-kd5:13.10.2.comm: Api ca sambādhā gharāvāsā bahukiccā bahukaraṇīyāti, “Still, household life is crowded, with much business and many duties.” I have added a bit from the commentary to make the sentence clearer. Ud-a 46: Kāmesu ādīnave kenaci pakārena diṭṭhepi na tāvāhaṁ gharāvāsato nikkhamituṁ asakkhiṁ, “Although I had seen the danger in sensual pleasures of whatever kind, I was not able to leave the household life for so long.”

pli-tv-kd5:13.10.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṃ viditvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ udānaṃ udānesi—
pli-tv-kd5:13.10.3.eng: Seeing the significance of this, the Buddha uttered a heartfelt exclamation:

pli-tv-kd5:13.10.4.eng: “Having seen the downside of the world,

pli-tv-kd5:13.10.6.eng: The noble one doesn’t delight in the bad;

pli-tv-kd5:13.10.7.eng: In the bad, the pure one doesn’t delight.”

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.2.pli: “paṭisammodati kho maṃ bhagavā, ayaṃ khvassa kālo yaṃ me upajjhāyo paridassī”ti—
pli-tv-kd5:13.11.2.eng: “The Buddha approves of me! This is the time to bring up what my preceptor said.”

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.3.pli: uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-kd5:13.11.3.eng: He got up from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, bowed down at the Buddha’s feet, and said,

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.4.pli: “upajjhāyo me, bhante, āyasmā mahākaccāno bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati, evañca vadeti avantidakkhiṇāpatho, bhante, appabhikkhuko.
pli-tv-kd5:13.11.4.eng: “Sir, my preceptor, Venerable Mahākaccāna, pays respect with his head at the Buddha’s feet.” He then repeated everything Mahākaccāna had asked him to say.

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.5.pli: Tiṇṇaṃ me vassānaṃ accayena kicchena kasirena tato tato dasavaggaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātāpetvā upasampadaṃ alatthaṃ, appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe appatarena gaṇena upasampadaṃ anujāneyya.

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.6.pli: Avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā;

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.7.pli: appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe guṇaṅguṇūpāhanaṃ anujāneyya.

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.8.pli: Avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, nahānagarukā manussā udakasuddhikā, appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe dhuvanahānaṃ anujāneyya.

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.9.pli: Avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhante, cammāni attharaṇāni, eḷakacammaṃ ajacammaṃ migacammaṃ.

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.10.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhante, majjhimesu janapadesu eragū moragū majjārū jantū;

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.11.pli: evameva kho, bhante, avantidakkhiṇāpathe cammāni attharaṇāni, eḷakacammaṃ ajacammaṃ migacammaṃ;

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.12.pli: appeva nāma bhagavā avantidakkhiṇāpathe cammāni attharaṇāni anujāneyya, eḷakacammaṃ ajacammaṃ migacammaṃ.

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.13.pli: Etarahi, bhante, manussā nissīmagatānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ cīvaraṃ denti—

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.19.pli: appeva nāma bhagavā cīvare pariyāyaṃ ācikkheyyā”ti.

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.20.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-kd5:13.11.20.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.21.eng: “In the southern region of Avantī there are few monks.

pli-tv-kd5:13.11.22.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sabbapaccantimesu janapadesu vinayadharapañcamena gaṇena upasampadaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:13.11.22.eng: Outside the central Ganges plain, I allow the full ordination to be given by a group of five, including one expert on the Monastic Law.

pli-tv-kd5:13.12.1.eng: In this regard, the following is outside the central Ganges plain:

pli-tv-kd5:13.12.2.pli: puratthimāya disāya gajaṅgalaṃ nāma nigamo, tassa parena mahāsālā, tato parā paccantimā janapadā, orato majjhe;
pli-tv-kd5:13.12.2.eng: In the eastern direction there is a town called Gajaṅgala, with another town called Mahāsālā just after it. Beyond it is outside the central Ganges plain. On the near side of it is the central Ganges plain.

pli-tv-kd5:13.12.3.pli: puratthimadakkhiṇāya disāya sallavatī nāma nadī, tato parā paccantimā janapadā, orato majjhe;
pli-tv-kd5:13.12.3.eng: In the south-eastern direction there is a river called Sallavatī. Beyond it is outside the central Ganges plain. On the near side of it is the central Ganges plain.

pli-tv-kd5:13.12.4.pli: dakkhiṇāya disāya setakaṇṇikaṃ nāma nigamo, tato parā paccantimā janapadā, orato majjhe;
pli-tv-kd5:13.12.4.eng: In the southern direction there is a town called Setakaṇṇika. Beyond it is outside the central Ganges plain. On the near side of it is the central Ganges plain.

pli-tv-kd5:13.12.5.pli: pacchimāya disāya thūṇaṃ nāma brāhmaṇagāmo, tato parā paccantimā janapadā, orato majjhe;
pli-tv-kd5:13.12.5.eng: In the western direction there is a brahmin village called Thūṇa. Beyond it is outside the central Ganges plain. On the near side of it is the central Ganges plain.

pli-tv-kd5:13.12.6.pli: uttarāya disāya usīraddhajo nāma pabbato, tato parā paccantimā janapadā, orato majjhe.
pli-tv-kd5:13.12.6.eng: In the northern direction there is a mountain called Usīraddhaja. Beyond it is outside the central Ganges plain. On the near side of it is the central Ganges plain.

pli-tv-kd5:13.12.7.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, evarūpesu paccantimesu janapadesu vinayadharapañcamena gaṇena upasampadaṃ.

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.1.pli: Avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhikkhave, kaṇhuttarā bhūmi kharā gokaṇṭakahatā.
pli-tv-kd5:13.13.1.eng: In Avantī the ground is dark and hard, made rough by the hooves of cattle.

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.2.eng: Outside the central Ganges plain, I allow sandals with multi-layered soles.

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.3.eng: In Avantī people value bathing and cleanliness.

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.4.eng: Outside the central Ganges plain, I allow unrestricted bathing.

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.5.pli: Avantidakkhiṇāpathe, bhikkhave, cammāni attharaṇāni, eḷakacammaṃ ajacammaṃ migacammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:13.13.5.eng: In Avantī sheepskins, goatskins, and deerskins are used as rugs,

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.6.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, majjhimesu janapadesu eragū moragū majjārū jantū;
pli-tv-kd5:13.13.6.eng: just as eragu grass, chaff-flower grass, majjāru grass, and jantu grass are used in the central Ganges plain.

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.7.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, avantidakkhiṇāpathe cammāni attharaṇāni, eḷakacammaṃ ajacammaṃ migacammaṃ.

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.8.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sabbapaccantimesu janapadesu cammāni attharaṇāni, eḷakacammaṃ ajacammaṃ migacammaṃ.
pli-tv-kd5:13.13.8.eng: Outside the central Ganges plain, I allow rugs of sheepskin, goatskin, and deerskin.

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.9.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, manussā nissīmagatānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ cīvaraṃ denti—
pli-tv-kd5:13.13.9.eng: And it may be that people give robe-cloth to monks who are outside the monastery zone, saying,

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.11.pli: Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, sādituṃ, na tāva taṃ gaṇanūpagaṃ yāva na hatthaṃ gacchatī”ti.
pli-tv-kd5:13.13.11.eng: I allow you to accept it and not start counting the days until you receive it in your hands.”
pli-tv-kd5:13.13.11.comm: This relates to Bu Np 1:2.17.1 and Bu Np 3:1.3.13.1.

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.12.eng: The fifth chapter on skins is finished.

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.41.eng: And the bad one with a cattle hide.

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.48.eng: He allowed rugs made of skin,

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.50.eng: The leader did these five favors,
pli-tv-kd5:13.13.50.comm: I read adās’ime with SRT.

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.52.eng: In this chapter there are sixty-three topics.

pli-tv-kd5:13.13.53.eng: The chapter on skins is finished.
